body:
@Antiarchitect well, a good place for you to start asking for feedback whether this feature (or others) is useful or not, is always the Rails Core mailing list.

Now about the feature itself, besides @rafaelfranca comments - which I agree, my other argument is that Active Record has been moving to a "less hash arguments" approach lately, which I think would go against this. 

Moreover, you can probably build the same thing with associations in case you really want that:

```ruby
class Author < AR::Base
  has_many :books
  has_many :special_books, conditions: "price < 5", order: "price ASC", limit: 5
end

@authors.to_xml include: :special_books
```

So I don't see a real need to change Rails since you can achieve the same right now. Thanks for your contribution :).
